verses.roman:
sṛjāila, jīyāila, tāṅre nā mānila
kṛtaghna ha-ilā, tāṅre skandha kruddha ha-ila

synonyms: sṛjāila—fructified; jīyāila—maintained; tāṅre—Him; nā—not; mānila—accepted; kṛtaghna—ungrateful; ha-ilā—thus became; tāṅre—to them; skandha—trunk; kruddha—angry; ha-ila—became.
translation: Some branches did not accept the original trunk that vitalized and maintained the entire tree. When they thus became ungrateful, the original trunk was angry at them.
